website_summaries.verdict: While this dog DNA test may not be the best option for learning the lineage of a mutt, it is an inexpensive way to discover major health issues you need to be aware of.
pros: Provides genetic health concerns for your dog’s breed or breeds
Includes cute certificate keepsake with your dog’s photo
cons: Its database of 97 dog breeds is somewhat limited

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY LIKE WE DID
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 kits to use with our rescues... Did not send pic of our dogs on purpose... it's recommended. Total waste of money. Black dog came back as rat terrier, our brown dog came back as yorkie!!!!! RIP OFF!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mcenjill

customer_reviews.title: nothing but big ripoff
customer_reviews.text: This item should not even get 1 star. Total waste of money. I was curious about these dna tests so I sent my dog's sample. He is a goldendoodle born in my house from my standard poodle and golden retriever. Both my pets and both purebred and registered with excellent pedigree. Result of dna supposed to take 10 days. It took 3 weeks laughing results saying pup is basset hound, wipet ,labrador and little portion of golden retriever. Nowhere it mentioned poodle .which is his mom
customer_reviews.author: misch

customer_reviews.title: There is no way our 25 lb dog is a Great Dane
customer_reviews.text: The other breeds the DNA test came back with (Rottweiler, Boxer, Irish Setter) are not small enough to balance the Great Dane's size and result in a dog that looks like a miniature lab. We were sorely disappointed. I requested a refund but was denied.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: So Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This product was a waste of money. I have a 12 lb dog and the results indicated that he was mixed with St. Bernard, Rotweiller, and Pit Bull. The most obvious mix was missing-Dachsund. He might have pit bull in his background (every island dog seems to) but the other dogs were just flat out wrong. I have mentioned the results to the vet and several others and they just look at my dog and laugh because the results are so off the mark. Save your money and just guess your dog's breed (which is what I suspect they did) or spend a few extra bucks for a more reputable company.
customer_reviews.author: Eby

customer_reviews.title: Horsepiffle.
customer_reviews.text: DNA MY DOG concluded that 70 lb. Chet is ca. a third Rhodesian Ridgeback, a third Shar-pei, and a third Boston terrier. A different lab's test concluded that he was one quarter Plott, one quarter Staffordshire Terrier, one quarter American Foxhound mix and the last quarter Chow Chow mix. I asked for some review of these varying results. The response I got from DNA MY DOG said the results had been reviewed, full stop, no further comment or information; the response was meaningless, starting with getting the dog's sex wrong...
customer_reviews.author: 1201SLD

customer_reviews.title: my dog is NOT a poodle
customer_reviews.text: I have a small, red, straight-haired dog, perhaps a long-haired chihuahua mix. I used DNA my Dog and the result came back 100% poodle. Anyone who looks at my dog will tell you theres no way thats possible. DNA my Dog took down my first review for violating community standards, so I'm being more understated with this one. 0/10
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Michelle Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of time and completely inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: We got this DNA test back after waiting. I think they were just guessing. It said he's part Border Collie and Terrier. I can tell by just looking at this dog that he is a bullmastiff. Don't waste your money or your time by the more expensive accurate one for $20 more. They are obviously overloaded with orders and are just guessing. If you do buy this product don't write down what you think it is leave that blank. Look at this picture you can tell just by looking that he is from a mastiff breed. What a joke!
customer_reviews.author: Harvey

customer_reviews.title: What mixture he really was, lol
customer_reviews.text: We tested our daughters dog as we were told he was a Chihuahua but when he reached over 18 pounds and still growing. We wanted to know what he was mixed with. Turns out he is 1/3 Chihuahua 1/3 Italian greyhound and 1/3 terrier
customer_reviews.author: crafty granny

customer_reviews.title: Easy to  use and quick response
customer_reviews.text: Simple envelope and easy to understand instructions. Was informed when they received the sample. Getting the sample completed was very quick and appreciated knowing the results. Dog's gonna be a bit bigger than expected :)
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A Snobl

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money or time!!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a load of crap!!! I think they just pick breeds out of a hat. My dog came back as Doberman pincher and dalmatian. What a joke!!! Those are 2 tall thin breeds, my dog is short and fat.
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Response took longer than they promised, The results were not consistent with the breed that we bought and had lineage records on. Their website did not allow me to upload a picture of the dog properly. I did it several times and image uploaded rotated without any ability to correct therefore the certificate they promised with findings along with picture did not work. Perhaps all dog DNA sites are not accurate, but I know I would never recommend this particular company.
customer_reviews.author: Clark

customer_reviews.title: This is the kit for fast, accurate results with a friendly company! And helpful tips on dog breeds.
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived and was very easy to use IF you follow instructions (ie- don't feed your dog beforehand, so best to do first thing in morning, AND leave in envelope open to dry for 30 minutes). So, be patient, and in just a couple of weeks, you receive a certificate and a breakdown of your dog's breed(s) via email! It was very interesting and is a fun activity for all. Recommend this firm and package.
customer_reviews.author: H Diez

customer_reviews.title: I would give this 0 stars if I could!
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of money and incredibly inaccurate. Wish I read more reviews before wasting $70 on this junk. Said my dog was a german shepherd, malamute, Rottweiler, beagle mix. Hah! No. Look at him. Such a scam. Don’t waste your money. Try wisdom panel or embark if funds allow it. Embark is BY FAR the best DNA test out there and tests for genetic diseases, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Ragen Huck

customer_reviews.title: Results on time and as promised
customer_reviews.text: I bought two kits as I have two mixed breed dogs. As it turns out, neither dog was the mix I was told I had, but the results were fascinating. The reports are easy to read and understand, and the certificate is a nice summary. The results were available within the time promised. I've seen other reports from other companies, but this was the best value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl A.

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying , easy to do
customer_reviews.text: Order 2, kits, fast email response. Kit was very easy to do. I have 2 pit bulls...fast delivery. It's almost 2 months and We have not received the certificate for the DNA ... Not too happy about this.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Garcia

customer_reviews.title: DNA my dog is fun, accurate and affordable.
customer_reviews.text: I have tested three dogs with this kit. The reason I continue with DNA my dog is because compared to one other test kit DNA my dog seems the most accurate. We tested our puppy in a rescue liter and one other dog was tested. The DNA test of another brand just didn't seem correct compared to the results we got from DNA my dog and why we continue to use this kit. Each time we have had surprises but really could see it once the test confirmed. Super fun to do and very affordable!
customer_reviews.author: Mieke Frishman

customer_reviews.title: BUT she is still a great pet, who knew
customer_reviews.text: Found Molly not a Lab as I had been told when adopting . BUT she is still a great pet, who knew..Catahola Leopard Cur..big name of 41# girl. Mixed with two other breeds..I like the oddity of her breed and looked strange breed up on line and there was a picture that could have been Molly. She appears to simply be a miniature Lab ...vet had said she was not so nw I know. Good idea and not too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Mcgee

customer_reviews.title: 100% SCAM
customer_reviews.text: I had my dog tested a few other places with consistent and contradictory results to those given by DNAmydog, confirming that this is a scam. You can't fake science. Either their laboratory has poor cross-contamination controls or they are just outright criminals. Either way, it is a scam and WILL be removed from Amazon after enough people report them.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: ... breeds they test for before you order and are disappointed with the results
customer_reviews.text: Check their list of breeds they test for before you order and are disappointed with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great service and happy to get results that match my pups personality
customer_reviews.text: Adopted a pup this year, told she was a minipin but she was too big..20lbs. Curiosity had me going nuts! Had to know her make up. We found out and her quirks and build match with results. They even answered my questions after results and always answered the phone. Highly suggest this product and great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica M. Barrera

customer_reviews.title: unknown breed of your dog
customer_reviews.text: I want to thank the DNAMYDOG company for the warm welcome I received as a new client! They informed me when they received my kit samples, sent me informative information about their company and was eager to answer any concerns or questions I might have. They informed me it might take up to 2 weeks for results, but I received them in a week! I own & run a Dog Training Center and I rescue train and rehabilitate injured and abused dogs. with the DNAMYDOG company I can give new owners better information on their adopted dog.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: After having to do the test TWICE because the first set of results were "contaminated" I waited twice as long as they promised. I had to call the company to make sure they didn't lose my test and after seeing the results I'm fairly certain that they did and just made things up. I didn't submit a photo, though I am interested in how the results may have been different if I had. Not sure if any dog DNA test is worth the money, but this one definitely was not. I don't see how this dog is even remotely Chow Chow or Golden Retriever.
customer_reviews.author: BBCG

customer_reviews.title: If I knew for sure.
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a mix, but I was told her mother was a full bred Australian shepherd. The test came back with no mention of that breed at all. The breeds mentioned ,except one looks nothing like our dog. The results came back in a timely manner and the company was helpful. I have another mixed breed that I am going to test to see if the test is more accurate,as I know what type dog was the mother.
customer_reviews.author: Keith B

customer_reviews.title: Fast results well priced
customer_reviews.text: New mix bred puppy. Wanted to know what breeds he was for health and training purpose. DNA MY DOG was well priced. I had my results in about a week and a half. Just amazing what you can find out about you animal. Always a surprise. The results are broken out by breed. There is all kinds of helpful information given to you scale of 1-10 this company is a 15.
customer_reviews.author: Sunni Morgan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money. The first results came back totally wrong considering that we knew what pure bred the mother was. When we complained about the results and mentioned what the mother's breed was, they offered to do another test. Lo and behold, that one came back that Molly was 75% terrier which we knew to begin with. No wonder they want a photo of your dog...gives them something to go on as the dna testing is totally bonkers.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Reaves Templeton

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of our money DO NOT BUY they must have tried to guess based off a picture they ask you to include. Use EMBARK, they were correct and even gave his parents breed. DNA my dog wasn’t even close and gave us only 2 breed mixtures which our dog is not.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Jorgensen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We decided to get this test because we had no idea what our puppy was made of. It was simple to swab her cheek I just stuck the swab between her gum line and cheek and twisted it around a little. It came with 4 so I used them all. We got our results back in just under 2 weeks and we’re surprised to find she is 50%-74% Great Pyrenees and 10%-20% Dalmatian and 10%-20% Boarder Collie.
customer_reviews.author: jacob112233

customer_reviews.title: After waiting over 2 months for the results, I ...
customer_reviews.text: After waiting over 2 months for the results, I was told to redo the test because there was too much DNA missing. I resubmitted and waited for several more weeks and asked again what was taking so long, and by the end of the day I had the results. Needless to say it was a joke. Our dog weighs about 8 pounds and is quite obviously a terrier mix of some sort. It came back as mainly Newfoundland (they weigh around 200 lbs.!!) and part Border Collie, German Shepherd and Poodle. Major scam! When I questioned them I received no reply.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast, reliable, professional
customer_reviews.text: I had a great experience with DNA My Dog. The kit was very simple and the instructions were very clear. Although it took about a week for their lab to receive the kit, they emailed as soon as they got it and the results were sent to me via email about a week later. They are very professional and I definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy H

customer_reviews.title: Easy to find out your dog's genetic makeup
customer_reviews.text: I had to find out what my dog was. I had a good idea, but since I did my DNA test, I wanted hers too. It only took 2 weeks, and came with a nice certificate. Since I bought the test, they offered me the genetic age test for $30. Since she was a rescue, it was good to know. The customer service is excellent. Just email them and you get very personalised service. I highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jax Hardy

customer_reviews.text: Took much longer to get results than expected. Not sure they tested the right swabs from my dogs. I have 2 small dogs that appear to be Chihuahua's but I know they are not purebreds. Therefore, I wanted a DNA to explain some characteristics. The DNA results appear absurd. A nine pound dog can not be a poodle/chow mix. This results are completely bogus. I hope they just mixed up the swabs. Otherwise, they just drew the results out of a hat. No wonder they asked for a photo - which I refused to send. I will purchase kits from another company and compare results. fwblonde.
customer_reviews.author: fwblonde

customer_reviews.title: breeds & behavior traits. health issues
customer_reviews.text: This is a good test. I have used it in the past and have always got a copy of the report by mail with my dog's picture on it. This time I only got the e mail copy. My printer does not make a great picture of y pup. I really wish they would mail me a result as well. Like the last time I used this. It is a good tool to know your dog breeds so you know what kind of behavior there is/will be
customer_reviews.author: spunkysox

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A JOKE!
customer_reviews.text: Completely inaccurate! Don't waste your money! I have a basset hound mix and basset hound wasn't part of their determination. Ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this kit!!! Scam!!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this kit!! They couldn’t get enough DNA off 2 samples. The results were so far fetched. I feel like they just threw a random combination of dogs together just to be done with it. It took a lot longer than expected too. I would go with a different company. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Akendall

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use; DNA results returned quickly & clearly!
customer_reviews.text: I received the test kit quickly and the DNA results came back more quickly than I expected. My questions regarding the results were immediately and clearly answered. Highly recommend this kit if you are interested in learning more about your pet! I used it for a rescue dog who was nearly dead when I found him. My intention is to rehome him, providing the new family with as much information as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: DNA MY Dog Results fit Millie's Personality Exactly
customer_reviews.text: Everything needed with complete instructions on how to do the DNA sample and mail it to the lab was in the kit. It was super easy to complete. Test results were available via website about two weeks after mailing sample. The written report was received just under four weeks after mailing sample. Very impressed with the certificate and the information about the breeds including typical personality traits and potential medical issues for the breeds. Great information to have. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine S. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Fun and informative!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is a 6yr old rescue and we have always wondered her breed. I didnt want to subject her to an unnecessary blood test, as she is very skittish and doesn't care for anything done at the vet. This test was so easy to do at home, and non-invasive which is important to me as a Nurse. The breed certificate is a fun way to display her breed as well. We love our mutt so much and now we know what illnesses she may be prone to. She is not either breed we were told she was, so now what we can tell people and be accurate. Thanks for making us more informed puppy parents!!
customer_reviews.author: Denise M.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This test is a scam. We have a small 35lb terrier or lab looking mix and our test results told us he was part bullmastif, English springer spaniel, golden retriever, and Chinese shar pei. There is no way he is any of those breeds.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Interesting and fun to know your mutts breed
customer_reviews.text: Like all pet lovers, it doesn't matter what mix my mutt is but it is an interesting and fun thing to have the DNA done. I found my dog breed is nothing what I thought it would be. We are delighted
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Vest

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend, waste of money. They could only identify the breed that our dog had the majority of. Our dog is a golden doodle labradoodle mix and they only showed Poodle on our results. I did a DNA test on our other dog that was a rescue several years ago with a different company and they could identify much smaller traces of several different breeds.
customer_reviews.author: JameyR

customer_reviews.title: Spot On!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical when i did this...but wow was i impressed! the results were ready fast and was super easy to do! Brody was a rescue. i knew right off the bat he was not purebred but thought he was mostly german shepherd....just couldnt put my finder on what he was mixed with. then my vet suggested a dog DNA test. after reading the reviews i chose DNA my dog!! I would have never guessed my brody was mixed with an Akita but now i see it....thank you doggie DNA for giving me piece of mind and now i can explain some behaviors! the customer service and communication was amazing also! ***Highly recommend DNA my dog to anyone!**
customer_reviews.author: michelle wilson

customer_reviews.title: What breed am I?
customer_reviews.text: I was very eager to find out the breed of my dog especially since the rescue and Vet were quite different. I found the results surprising, but the wide range of percentages weren’t very defining. Would like a more accurate description.
customer_reviews.author: Plkreimer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and loaded with information.
customer_reviews.text: This dna test was so easy to use and one of the cheaper ones! I received the results in about two weeks and my dogs are now in the database. It’s been fun to see other people’s dogs in the database with all the breed combinations. The database is loaded with information and I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Ballestero

customer_reviews.title: Super pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: From the time we received the kit from Amazon to getting my dog’s results was only 3 weeks! I had guessed right with one of the results, but completely surprised on the other two! I adopted Stark from Animal Control two years ago and always wondered what she was! The test was easy to give, the instructions easy to follow. I definitely recommend for the price. It also has a really neat app with a lot of breed information! Stark turned out to be a bulldog and Boston terrier!
customer_reviews.author: Wicked_Princess

customer_reviews.title: Don't Be Surprised By What They Find Out!
customer_reviews.text: I was curious about my dogs ancestry, so I bought a kit. It was very easy to use and I got her results back within a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: singlelady

customer_reviews.title: Far-fetched results
customer_reviews.text: The results for our dog's DNA seemed so off the wall. A dog that looks and acts like a (redbone coon) hound and lab has results that label him a Rottweiler, Jack Russell Parson terrier, and border terrier appears to be far fetched--almost as if the samples had been switched with someone else's!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Ochsner

customer_reviews.title: This is a scam. Do not give these people ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a scam . Do not give these people your money . The reason they ask for a picture is Bc they are guessing !! My dogs report was : Austrian cattle dog and Labrador . WRONG. And I know this Bc the rescue I adopted him from , rescued his momma as well and she was some kind of hound ( Def nether of the breeds listed for my Dog ).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this product. We know that our dogs mother is a pit mix and the male is the mystery. I was hoping we would find out with this test but the results did not even include pit bull. I really feel like this is a scam and I'm upset that I even spent the money on this. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: alessia

customer_reviews.title: Scam!!!
customer_reviews.text: Total scam!!!! I have a golden retriever and wanted to see if there was any lab in her at all and even with sending a picture of her (which was a red flag as soon as I got promoted to do so) and they told me she was a mastiff, chow chow and malamute. She’s gold, almost white and resembles none of those qualities. One of the worst purchases I’ve ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This product is an absolute joke. I have never written an Amazon Review but I am going out of the way to write one for this product. We sent in our dog's DNA sample. The first report we got back basically said our dog was a Pekingese. If you could come up with the opposite description of the dog, that would be it. After complaining, they reran a back up sample and came up with Alaskan Malamute and Dalmation. Again, not even close. How one sample could read Pekingese and the other Dalmation and Alaskan Malamute is beyond me. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Coleman

customer_reviews.title: I was somewhat surprised at the results. We had ...
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat surprised at the results. We had seen our puppy's mother and she was part Border Collie, but that did not register at all on the DNA test. It showed Rottweiler and do not see any characteristics of this breed in her or her temperament. I definitely see the American Staffordshire and Basenji. I am curious to possibly try a different company to see if the results are the same or at least similar.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: INACCURATE RESULTS
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 12 of these test to DNA tested an entire litter of puppies I had. I questioned the results so I done a second swab on one of the puppies to check and see if I got the same results. The same dog had two different results! DO NOT purchase from the company if you want an accurate result. Almost $1,000 spent and the results are not accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Givens

customer_reviews.title: Great if you are curious about your dog!
customer_reviews.text: Found out what our little rescue is made of! Very quick and easy to use. Kept us informed all during the process. Results were posted on line and we received a hard copy certificate when it was all over. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I've always been curious what breeds our two rescues are. We are pretty sure that Bear is a schnoodle. (We're still waiting on his results, which is fine; it hasn't been long since we sent them in.) Sheldon's results came back yesterday as a Chihuahua (what we thought), poodle, dachshund, Italian greyhound. I'm a little surprised that he doesn't have some sort of herding breed in him because he always tries to herd our guests! Very happy so far with this company's service. Despite Covid-19, results have been timely and instructions were easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda LaRiviere

customer_reviews.text: I really liked this and will buy again if I ever need it.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money with this company
customer_reviews.text: Save your money & order from another company. This company only test like 110 breeds & because of this they can't give you an accurate test. Look for another company that test for more breeds because my test came back with two breeds so far off the wall that they made no sense. We will be having him retested by another testing company that test for over 250 breeds from Amazon. Check the companies website before you order so you know how many breeds they test for which should help you determine if you buy the test & not the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: having the photo as well as the sample feels like cheating! If you use this company
customer_reviews.text: These test results took several weeks longer than the guaranteed two weeks. I also regretted sending them a photo of my dog, which they asked for to be included on his "certificate." In retrospect, having the photo as well as the sample feels like cheating! If you use this company, I'd refrain from sending them a photo.
customer_reviews.author: MJS

customer_reviews.title: NOT EVEN CLOSE
customer_reviews.text: The results were totally absurd. A 53 lb. long haired brindle dog that highly resembles an irish setter in stature and fur silkiness is DNA'd as a wimereiner, beagle, min pin mix. Uh, even my vet said I was ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn A. Vanswol

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Not accurate at all. Should have read the reviews... Came back and said our dog was boxer and pug!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I followed all of the directions and have received no information months later. I cant find a way to contact the company to ask for the results. I was disappointed because I was really looking forward to finding out my dog's breed.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Anne Barno

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful product, backed up by exceptional customer support
customer_reviews.text: Collecting samples for your dog is very easy and painless. Follow the directions, they're in there for a reason, and everything works as promised. I testes litter mates that came back with bizarre results. I ask for a more in depth explanation and the customer care representative agreed that my results weren't normal (but not impossible) so she sent me 2 new tests just to confirm the results. I was happy with the processing system as it was but having timely and caring customer support pushed them over the top!
customer_reviews.author: Chellyfellow

customer_reviews.title: You get your results from them
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as stated. Took the 2 weeks for results, but we did get them.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Takes forever, website difficult to navigate
customer_reviews.text: The kit comes with an app. The website is difficult to navigate. Almost impossible to register without staff help. Results took a month. Customer service was very responsive so i ordered a second one For my other dog thinking the first was a fluke. Same thing only worse. Results are good but take forever and Difficult to navigate website/app.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Totally inaccurate report
customer_reviews.text: We feel cheated because it was a totally inaccurate report, even our vet agrees with us... sad waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Hoppy41

customer_reviews.title: The Customer Service exceeded my expectation
customer_reviews.text: It was fun to find out our dogs breed information. We were convinced that our pet was a Rat Terrier, Toy Terrier or Jack Russell mix. Coloring also makes him appear to be a Terrier breed. Shocker that he was a 75% Chihuahua! He does not have Chihuahua characteristics (I have many Chihuahua mixes), and he is 25% Australian Shepherd which helped explain his wonderful nature. If you adore your pet as much as we do, it is fun to find out and well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Scoreboard47

customer_reviews.title: Purchase this kit, you’ll be so happy you did.
customer_reviews.text: Love this product and the company is great to work with! We purchased two kits and both dogs had no problem letting us swab their cheeks. We didn’t have any breeds in our girls that we thought and knowing helps us understand more of their personality traits. I’ve recommended this kit to dozens of people!
customer_reviews.author: Jen A

customer_reviews.title: WINDY DNA UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: So far have not received any results, going on 3 weeks. Got DNA results level 2 Border Collie, level 3 Redbone Coonhound. Now, I ask you does this baby look like a coonhound? Her mother was a Jack Russell, father unknown since some wonderful individual put abandoned her while she was pregnant with my baby girl. I really don’t care what she she is. I love her anyway, but it would be nice to know for medical purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our obvious Jack Russell Terrier to find out if he had relation to any other dog breeds. The results were Chow Chow, Border Collie, Poodle, and Staffordshire Bull Terrier; all big dogs. This test does not produce results. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Callaway Johnson

customer_reviews.title: DELIVERED AS PROMISED - NOW I KNOW MY PUPS BREED
customer_reviews.text: I purchased after a friend had received her results. I couldn't believe how accurate. So fun! I recently rescued a pup from the pound. I had no idea his breed. In just a few short weeks, I received the results. I didn't submit a picture because I thought that may be too much of a clue. My results came back 75% poodle/25% golden retriever. I think its very accurate. And easy, just two swabs of my pups mouth.
customer_reviews.author: B.DEN

customer_reviews.title: Quick easy and exciting results.
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to use and we got our results within two weeks. It was so fun finding out what our rescue baby was! We then had a great time looking up pictures of the dogs that she is made up of!!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Wickham

customer_reviews.title: main breed is what they look like.
customer_reviews.text: Only determines four levels of breed, not percentages. Sent in two samples for what the adoption people said was a pair of siblings, got back different results. Still, main breed is what they look like.
customer_reviews.author: PC Paladin

customer_reviews.title: The results were not totally unexpected, but were a ...
customer_reviews.text: The results were not totally unexpected, but were a little different than the Wisdom Panel results. They both had American Staffordshire terrier DNA my dog had AMST at level 2 . Border terrier,boxer and pinscher at level 4. The wisdom panel had one parent as an am staff terrier minature poodle cross and the other parent as an am staff mixed with most likely sporting breed(lab, retriever) and the rest terrier I think that DNA my dog was somewhat correct just suprised that they did not pick up the poodle
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: This was a complete waste of money. The breed that I was told my dog is, was not even close. My dog weighs 10 lbs, soaking wet, the dog he was matched to weighed 60. My dog is white, the dog we were matched to only is black. I have contacted the company and am asking for a full refund. One other thing an animal shelter and vet both said what my dog's breed is. Instead of giving money to these scammers, love your dog for who he/she is, and donate the money to your local shelter.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Scotto

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: They were so ni e to deal with and got me the Andrews we needed with clarification and understated with extra knowledge to learn about dog .
customer_reviews.author: kathryn HARRIS

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t get my dog to allow me to swab her cheek. My dog is very fussy about her mouth.
customer_reviews.author: suzanne kehler

customer_reviews.title: Feel like a refund is in
customer_reviews.text: This DNA rate is a complete ripoff. The report to la that our golden retriever was 75 percent golden retriever. That was the extent of the report It did not give us any info on the other 25 percent.How ridiculous.... Feel like a refund is in order
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: DNAMYDOG.COM
customer_reviews.text: I liked that the service was fast. Nice certificate also!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Marie Witko

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your $
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time with this one. They guessed by the photo I posted not actual DNA. Spend a little more with another company and get real results.
customer_reviews.author: c paszek

customer_reviews.title: This was pretty cool, the hardest part was getting the swab ...
customer_reviews.text: This was pretty cool, the hardest part was getting the swab from our little puppy, she didn't like it one bit LOL. After sending the swab's off for testing it took just a couple of weeks to get the results, we found that Little Emma had level 2 Border Collie and level 3 Miniature Pinscher. I would recommend this test to anyone who truly wants to know the breed of their dog.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Harper

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Trash
customer_reviews.text: Should have read all the reviews. This is a horrible product. It was impossible to register on their site. This is going in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Jennette

customer_reviews.title: Apparently about 3% of swabs don't have enough DNA to ...
customer_reviews.text: Apparently about 3% of swabs don't have enough DNA to read, so they sent me another set of swabs - all at their expense. I had a friend hold my dogs head as I reswabed, and I have sent it back in.
customer_reviews.author: PAT MARCARELLI

customer_reviews.title: I have my doubts
customer_reviews.text: I've read reviews before with pictures saying "Does this dog look like a (whatever it came back as)? It's like that. Perhaps they're right in the results but my dogs don't look like what they say. Fun to do if you have the extra money but don't expect much.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Bocco

customer_reviews.title: Great instructions and now I wait for the
customer_reviews.text: received this test quickly. Great instructions and now I wait for the results
customer_reviews.author: Karen Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Help
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea who my results would come from and its been well over 3 weeks also dont know who to contact
customer_reviews.author: Lany

customer_reviews.title: Not even close... garbage
customer_reviews.text: A pug and a dox? He’s got long legs and the coloring of a silky/yorkie. I don’t trust this test at all after reading the reviews. I wish I wouldn’t have wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Stauffer

customer_reviews.title: Good DNA Kit
customer_reviews.text: The information was detailed and matched up with our dog
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Kinzie

customer_reviews.title: Not even close!
customer_reviews.text: DNA results did not reflect the breeds the dogs resemble AT ALL. One 59 lb dog with very short hair reported as chi hua hua, Yorkshire terrier and Keeshond. Other black lab looking 65 lb dog reported as part greyhound, whippet and golden retriever. Sent photo of one dog that was not returned with results. Photos apparently did not help them much.
customer_reviews.author: Cshanklin

customer_reviews.title: Please do not waste your money on this
customer_reviews.text: This is a scam. Our dog is clearly mostly a beagle and the results said that she was 90% Labrador retriever. Please do not waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Craig M Hermiller

customer_reviews.title: Long processing time
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to test my dog to see what his great composition was, was a bit disappointed to see that the report came back with percentages and a full breakdown but with broad categories.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Girl in SC

customer_reviews.title: Where are the results of my dog’s DNA sample
customer_reviews.text: This was a DNA test for my puppy to determine her breed(s). We followed the instructions and returned the swabs, but have not received any data from this seller/ company.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl fisher

customer_reviews.title: I got this to find out exactly what kind of ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this to find out exactly what kind of dog I really have and I was very surprised by the result. It took 2 weeks to get the result once they received my test. Well worth getting again.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Was surprised by some of the results, but for ...
customer_reviews.text: Was surprised by some of the results, but for the most part they make sense. Takes much longer than 2 weeks, but only because it take the test longer to get to the Canadian lab. Results were delivered 2 weeks after the lab received the test.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Randall

customer_reviews.title: Finding Fido!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great idea for our family. Our pet had certain "ways" about her that we had speculated was due to different breeds. Once we got the results, we were able to relate to her better by knowing her pedigree for sure and no longer speculating. I got one for my sister for Christmas (to test her dog). Once we get the results back, we are having a "breed reveal" party. We are so excited!
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It was easy and I got my results a week early.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Henkes

customer_reviews.title: The DNA was easy and the company produced results fast and efficiently
customer_reviews.text: It was exciting to find out what breed my furbaby is. The DNA was easy and the company produced results fast and efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Lindy Lou

customer_reviews.title: DNA
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the results. Easy to use app. Quick response.
customer_reviews.author: M.Olin

customer_reviews.title: Every thing was in the kit.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my counselor and we are hoping to find out what kind a breed her dog is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect results
customer_reviews.text: Results are totally wrong. There is no way this is correct. Results show miniature pinscher, belgian termuren and redbone coonhound. This is what our dog looks like. No way does she resemble any of those breeds. Going to try another company.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Baugham

customer_reviews.title: Not terribly accurate
customer_reviews.text: Results were bizarre to the point of ridiculous. It identified our lab mix as a blend of three different bulldogs and nothing else. I would get one of the higher rated kits and not waste your money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: HighRockHome

customer_reviews.title: The results really are not my dog's background. It's ...
customer_reviews.text: The results really are not my dog's background. It's obvious when you see the results and compare that with my pup.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Lopes

product_meta.title: Dna My Dog - Canine Breed Identification Test Kit - at-Home Cheek Swab Kit - Personality Traits
product_meta.description: Canine DNA genetic testing is used to discover all of the breeds in a dog. Understanding the breeds in a dog can contribute to the better health and well-being of the dog. Tests can also be used to confirm breeds if not sure. Ideal for adopted dogs and for people with mixed breeds. Results emailed in 2 weeks or less upon receipt of your sample. A photo is not necessary unless you want one on your final results package
feature_bullets: DNA MY Dog Can Determine The Breeds In Your Dog Through A Simple, At-Home DNA Cheek Swab. Results Include A Report On All Breeds Found In Your Dog's DNA By Percentage, A Custom Certificate And Report
Results In About Two Weeks From Receipt Of Sample, Perfect For Animal Shelters, Veterinary Offices and At-Home Use
Includes Breed Determination Report And Canine Breed DNA Analysis Certificate. Lists Breeds Found By Level Percentage Found In Your Dog's Genetics.
An Outline Of The Generic Health Concerns And Personality Traits For Every Breed Found In Your Dog's Genetic Profile
Acquiring Genetic Breed Knowledge About Your Dog Will Help You Be More Proactive About The Wellness Of Your Pet
